cache_inode_get.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00087 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00088 #include "config.h"
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 #include "LRU_List.h"
00092 #include "log_functions.h"
00093 #include "HashData.h"
00094 #include "HashTable.h"
00095 #include "fsal.h"
00096 #include "cache_inode.h"
00097 #include "stuff_alloc.h"
00098 
00099 #include <unistd.h>
00100 #include <sys/types.h>
00101 #include <sys/param.h>
00102 #include <time.h>
00103 #include <pthread.h>

00105 
00123 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_get( cache_inode_fsal_data_t * pfsdata, 
00124                                  fsal_attrib_list_t      * pattr,
00125                                  hash_table_t            * ht,  
00126                                  cache_inode_client_t    * pclient, 
00127                                  fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext, 
00128                                  cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus )
00129 {
00130   hash_buffer_t             key, value ;
00131   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
00132   cache_inode_status_t      status ;
00133   LRU_entry_t             * plru_entry ;
00134   fsal_attrib_list_t        object_attributes     ;
00135   fsal_status_t             fsal_status ;
00136   cache_inode_create_arg_t  create_arg ;
00137   cache_inode_file_type_t   type ;
00138   int                       hrc = 0 ;
00139   fsal_attrib_list_t        fsal_attributes ;
00140   cache_inode_fsal_data_t * ppoolfsdata = NULL ;
00141   
00142   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00143   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00144 
00145   /* stats */
00146   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00147   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00148   
00149   /* Turn the input to a hash key */
00150   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, pfsdata, pclient ) )
00151     {
00152       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_UNAPPROPRIATED_KEY ;
00153       
00154       /* stats */
00155       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00156       
00157       ppoolfsdata = (cache_inode_fsal_data_t *)key.pdata ;
00158       RELEASE_PREALLOC( ppoolfsdata, pclient->pool_key, next_alloc ) ; 
00159       
00160       return NULL ;
00161     }
00162   
00163   switch( hrc = HashTable_Get( ht, &key, &value ) )
00164     {
00165     case HASHTABLE_SUCCESS:
00166       /* Entry exists in the cache and was found */
00167       pentry = (cache_entry_t *)value.pdata ;
00168       
00169       /* return attributes additionally */
00170       cache_inode_get_attributes( pentry,  pattr )  ;
00171       
00172       break ;
00173       
00174     case HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY:
00175       /* Cache miss, allocate a new entry */
00176       
00177       /* If we ask for a dir cont (in this case pfsdata.cookie != FSAL_DIR_BEGINNING, we have 
00178        * a client who performs a readdir in the middle of a directory, when the direcctories
00179        * have been garbbage. we must search for the DIR_BEGIN related to this DIR_CONT */
00180       if( pfsdata->cookie != DIR_START )
00181         {
00182           /* added for sanity check */
00183           DisplayLog( "=======> Pb cache_inode_get: line %u pfsdata->cookie != DIR_START (=%u) on object whose type is %u",
00184                       __LINE__, pfsdata->cookie, cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( fsal_attributes.type ) ) ;
00185           
00186           pfsdata->cookie = DIR_START ;
00187           
00188           /* Free this key */
00189           cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00190 
00191           /* redo the call */
00192           return cache_inode_get( pfsdata, pattr, ht, pclient, pcontext, pstatus ) ; 
00193         }
00194 
00195 
00196       /* First, call FSAL to know what the object is */
00197       fsal_attributes.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ;
00198       fsal_status =  FSAL_getattrs( &pfsdata->handle, pcontext, &fsal_attributes ) ;
00199       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00200         { 
00201           *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00202      
00203           DisplayLog( "cache_inode_get: line %u cache_inode_status=%u fsal_status=%u,%u ", 
00204                         __LINE__, *pstatus, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00205 
00206           if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00207             {
00208                 cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00209 
00210                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_get: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00211 
00212                 if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00213                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_get: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00214 
00215                  *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00216             }
00217 
00218            /* stats */
00219           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00220           
00221           /* Free this key */
00222           cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00223 
00224           return NULL ;  
00225         }
00226       
00227     
00228       
00229       /* The type has to be set in the attributes */
00230       if( !FSAL_TEST_MASK( fsal_attributes.supported_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_TYPE ) )
00231         { 
00232           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR ;
00233 
00234           /* stats */
00235           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00236 
00237           /* Free this key */
00238           cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00239           
00240           return NULL ;
00241         }
00242 
00243       /* Get the cache_inode file type */
00244       type = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( fsal_attributes.type ) ;
00245       
00246       if( type == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
00247         {
00248           FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( fsal_attributes.asked_attributes ) ;
00249           FSAL_SET_MASK( fsal_attributes.asked_attributes, pclient->attrmask ) ;
00250           fsal_status = FSAL_readlink( &pfsdata->handle, pcontext, &create_arg.link_content, &fsal_attributes  ) ;
00251           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )  
00252             { 
00253               *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00254               
00255                /* stats */
00256               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00257               
00258               /* Free this key */
00259               cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00260 
00261               if(  fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) 
00262                {
00263                  cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00264 
00265                  DisplayLog( "cache_inode_get: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00266 
00267                  if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00268                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_get: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00269 
00270                  *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00271 
00272                 }
00273 
00274               return NULL ;
00275             }
00276         }
00277       
00278       /* Add the entry to the cache */
00279       pentry = cache_inode_new_entry( pfsdata, 
00280                                       &fsal_attributes, 
00281                                       type, 
00282                                       &create_arg,
00283                                       NULL, /* never used to add a new DIR_CONTINUE within the scope of this function */
00284                                       ht,
00285                                       pclient, 
00286                                       pcontext, 
00287                                       FALSE, /* This is a population, not a creation */
00288                                       pstatus ) ;
00289 
00290       /* Set the returned attributes */
00291       *pattr = fsal_attributes ;
00292       
00293       /* Now, exit the switch/case and returns */
00294       break ;
00295       
00296     default:
00297       /* This should not happened */
00298       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00299       
00300       /* stats */
00301       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00302 
00303       /* Free this key */
00304       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00305       
00306       return NULL ;
00307       break ;
00308     }
00309 
00310   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00311 
00312   /* valid the found entry, if this is not feasable, returns nothing to the client */
00313   P( pentry->lock ) ; 
00314   if( ( *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00315     {
00316       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00317       pentry = NULL ;
00318     }
00319   V( pentry->lock ) ;
00320 
00321   /* stats */
00322   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_GET] += 1 ;
00323 
00324   /* Free this key */
00325   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00326 
00327   return pentry ;
00328 } /* cache_inode_get */
00329
